intro: Dorstenia exaltata, commonly known as the "Devil's Backbone," is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, twisted, and often spiny stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Dorstenia exaltata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
